intro: Sida malacophylla, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural areas. Sida malacophylla is an annual herb that can become invasive in certain environments.
